SENT.plain: Obesity constitutes a critical risk factor for the development of many life threatening diseases, particularly insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes
Adipose tissue plays an important role in regulating whole body energy homeostatsis and obesity-related insulin resistance
Inflammation has been commonly linked to insulin resistance
Recent studies demonstrated that adipose tissue is an important source for producing inflammatory molecules in the obese state, primarily due to accumulation of macrophages
Animal models deficient in key inflammatory molecules or with reduced adipose macrophage infiltration are protected from development of obesity-related insulin resistance
Repression of adipose inflammation may be a useful approach to ameliorate obesity-associated metabolic disorders
